notes: Tenth-generation Civic. Available as sedan, coupe, or hatchback. Type R debuts with 306 hp. Manual transmission available. Turbocharged engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Civic article, January 2025 revision.

Ninth-generation Civic. Available as sedan or coupe. Si performance variant. Manual transmission available. Reliable compact car. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Civic article, January 2025 revision.

Ninth-generation Accord. Available as sedan or coupe. Manual transmission available. Hybrid variant offered. V6 option. Hybrid requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Accord article, January 2025 revision.

Tenth-generation Accord. Sedan-only. Turbocharged engines. Manual transmission on 2.0T. Hybrid available. No V6. Hybrid requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Accord article, January 2025 revision.
Fourth-generation CR-V. Best-selling crossover. I4-only powertrain. AWD available. Spacious and practical. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda CR-V article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth-generation CR-V. Turbocharged engine. Hybrid variant added 2020. Best-selling crossover continues. Hybrid requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda CR-V article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation HR-V for North America. Subcompact crossover. Manual transmission available. Magic Seat system. Entry-level Honda SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda HR-V article, January 2025 revision.
Third-generation Pilot. Three-row seating for 8. V6-only powertrain. 9-speed automatic added 2019. Family SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Pilot article, January 2025 revision.
Passport nameplate returns. Two-row SUV based on Pilot. AWD standard. More rugged than CR-V. Off-road capable. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Passport article, January 2025 revision.
Second-generation Ridgeline. Unibody construction. AWD standard. In-bed trunk. Dual-action tailgate. Unique truck design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Ridgeline article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth-generation Odyssey. Seven or eight-passenger seating. V6-only powertrain. Wide-mode second-row seats. Popular family minivan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Odyssey article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth-generation Odyssey. Seven or eight-passenger seating. Magic Slide second-row seats. Premium family minivan. 10-speed automatic added 2018. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Odyssey article, January 2025 revision.

Third-generation Insight hybrid sedan. Sedan body style. Looks similar to Civic. Hybrid-only powertrain. Discontinued 2022. Hybrid system requires specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Insight article, January 2025 revision.

Advanced technology sedan. Available as PHEV or hydrogen fuel cell. PHEV: 47 miles electric range. Fuel cell California only. Discontinued 2021. PHEV and fuel cell require highly specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Honda Clarity article, January 2025 revision.
